result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shemonda M. Scott

records.addlTxt:
9:18 AM Defendant Shemonda M. Scott in court.  Attorney Seth Elijah Johnson in court for Shemonda M. Scott.  Attorney Andrew Joseph Burgoyne in court for State of Wisconsin. Clerk HM.  Atty Johnson requests adjmt to discuss case with state. Trial scheduled.  Bond continued.
Jury status hearing scheduled for January 19, 2023 at 11:00 am.
Jury selection scheduled for January 23, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for January 24, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on October 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.  This case has been assigned to Judge Dougvillo.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: of Judge filed by Atty Johnson

Minutes:  9:08am.  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Daniel Tombasco appeared for the State.  Atty Seth Johnson appeared on behalf of deft.  No appearance by deft.  BW authorized; $500 cash bond.  Prior bond forfeited.  Case recalled @ 10:20am.  Deft apeared @ 10:10am.  Warrant vacated.  Bond re-instated.  Defense orally requests a subst. of Judge Gabriele.  Atty instructed to file written subst. of judge.  Court will review.  In addition, State reports there is a new referral for this deft.  Status set at 9/21/22 @ 10:45am.

Attorney Dan Tombasco appeared for the State.  Assistant District Attorney Daniel Bernard Deida appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney S. Johnson.   Clerk. M.Burke. The state is going to file an amended complaint to get rid of the DV enhancer. PTC set to 08/10/22 at 9:00.

NO RECORD MADE.  Attorney Dan Tombasco appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney S. Johnson.   Clerk. M.Burke.   State in victim rights compliance. Atty Johnson state's he needs to reach out to the state and get some information from joint services. STC set to 06/30/22 at 9:00.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

CONTINUED POSTED
  PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  *Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with: Delano M C or Shatara V.

02:12 PM    State appears by Attorney Alexander Huber.  Defendant appeared in court in person.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  The Court finds probable cause in this case today.  Def. is referred to the Public Defender.  If not eligible, def. to retain his own counsel. Court date will not be adjourned due to def.'s failure to retain counsel.  Plea of Not Guilty entered by the court..  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 29, 2022 at 01:40 pm.  Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.  $350  Cash bond continued w/ same conditions (see previous bond entry).  Cash bond on deposit $350.  ts
